description: The round payoff this round was 4. You, Kate chose to play option 1.John chose to play option 2. You received a payoff of -4.
John's strategy is primarily cooperative but can defect opportunistically
Mutual defection imposes catastrophic penalties, incentivizing caution
Defecting when the opponent cooperates offers high short-term gains but risks triggering retaliation (as seen in Kate’s -4 payoff when John exploited her choice of 1).
API access enables mutual prediction, creating a dynamic where strategies must balance exploitation and trust (since both players can adapt based on observed behavior).
